description: From Middle French h√©ritable, from Old French heritable.

adjectives.description: heritable (comparative more heritable, superlative most heritable)

examples: An heritable crown, or an heritable throne, or by what other fanciful name such things may be called, have no other significant explanation than that mankind are heritable property.

entries.meaning: Genetically transmissible from parent to offspring; hereditary.
examples: But if we consider that all heritable variations must have their roots in the germ-plasm, and further, that when personal selection does not intervene, ...
